mensPants.title: Dockers Men's Classic Fit Easy Khaki Pants (Regular and Big & Tall)
mensPants.description: Easy care, easy wear, men's stretch khaki pants. When the occasion calls for a polished look, these versatile straight leg khaki pants will keep you looking stylish all day. Now with stretch for performance, no wrinkles technology, and an all motion comfort waistband, these men's khaki pants are instant favorites.

customerReviewTitles: Cheaply made and wear thin quick.
BEWARE OF THE WAIST SIZE. IT'S NOT WHAT AMAZON SAYS.
Didn't last 10 wears before falling apart.
customerReviewBodies: I'm very disappointed in these. I bought these in 3 other colors (black, light khaki and dark khaki) several months and they are great pants. So I figured I'd get them in a couple new colors (navy, grey) and it was very obvious these were not the same pants. They feel cheaper and of lower quality. The worst part though is after just ONE wear, I noticed the pants getting rub marks/wearing material. I get it. I have very muscular legs. They're big. They run. That's fine. But the other three that are at least 5 months old show no wear (see khaki picture to compare) but these show tremendous wear after 2 wears in this picture. I'm very disappointed. Especially after the great experience with the other three pairs I have.
T

I did not wear Dockers or any other business casual type pants on a regular basis until now. As such I don't have much experience with these types of pants but I'll give my two cents, first impressions and a future follow up.

First off, I don't know what D3 Dockers are but do agree with other reviewers that the material is pretty thin. It is also stretchy to a small degree which I like because I'm makes the pants very comfortable to wear. The for is spot on perfect and it's the for in the legs that set these apart for me. I have another pair of wranglers khakis that fit very good as well and are thicker, but I'd have to give comfort to these Dockers.

Now I haven't had these very long at all, just tried them on with shoes and did a wide range of movements with them. I do feel that over time, and sooner than other pants these will wear out in hotspot areas. This remains to be seen however. I ordered 5 pairs that I will be rotating through I'm sure I'll get a variety of experience with how these truly perform.

As far as colors go I'd say their accurate, though I ordered one pair, something Pebble color perhaps, and no one who sees them can agree on whether they are dark gray or brown or dark green. They'll still work very well with the typical business casual shirt colors of today though.

All in all I'm happy with them and I will update this review as I wear them in.

I'm very picky about pants and the only other pants I own that I really like are Khaki Dockers Classic Fit. I've been looking for gray dress pants for a while and after buying and returning another brand of pants I decided to buy these Burma Grey Dockers. I should've bought these from the start.
I bought 1 size up, normally I wear 36W x 29L but I purchased 38W x 30L just in case it was too tight. It fit fine and I can actually pull it up higher which I honestly prefer. The material of the pants is decent. It feels pretty sturdy, it's not going to rip anytime soon. I've worn it 4 times in the span of 1 1/2 months and there is no wear or tear anywhere. The front button is still holding up too. There's no loose threads anywhere either.
Overall, this is a great pair of pants, nice color, material, fit and look.
S
I

Dockers needs to sit in the naughty chair. Not what I expected at this price point. After one month of wearing once or twice per week to a business casual job, the color and fabric are fading and wearing outlines of my wallet and my cellphone through the pockets. There are mystery rips frilling out and unthreading in them too. I would think I'd notice if I was running into anything that was cutting through my pants, but nope. They seemed nice at first, but not for long. The stitching is also coming loose around the belt loops. Again, it's only been a month, so maybe 4 or 5 washes. See my pictures. They look like they're about 10 years old even though they're basically brand new.

My husband has gone up a waist size. I got him some new pants and they are snug, so I went to the 36 waist size (he was a 34). They fit him nicely except for the thighs that are too big. All his pants are too big in the thigh. I am not worried about that. I will try for not such a loose fit on him. I like the dockers because the material is nice and he can wear them to church.
nice & dressy

I wrote a positive feedback for this item earlier when I tried the first pants. I ordered two pants and did not use the second pants until today. When I removed the item labels, I found the pants textile material on the back having 6 cuts 1cm each, seems like a manufacturing defect or it was cut during packaging. Unfortunately, I am unable to use them and don't know if the item can be replaced.
M

I previously bought the same pair of pants in the Dark Pebble (brown) color. I like these pants because they are comfortable and have a 'Casual' look.
I ordered the same pants in the Heather Storm (grey) however this color makes them look much more like 'Dress Pants' which I do not want, so I returned them.

Not the Docker fabric I am used to - very shiny like oldschool dress pants, not business casual/workwear. Hoping with a few aggressive washes the nap in the fabric gets raised and this improves.
Leg fit is also not the same as usual dockers - feels like I have bell bottoms on which also kills the business casual vibe.

mensPants.title: Haggar Men's Premium No Iron Khaki Classic Fit Expandable Waist Flat Front Pant
mensPants.description: Our new Premium No Iron Khaki looks as great as it feels. Stretchable cotton-blend fabric, hidden expandable waistband and permanent crease will keep you looking sharp and comfortable. If you like our Work to Weekend khaki, you'll love this slightly dressier lighter-weight option. Looking great never felt so good.

customerReviewTitles: Poor quality pants, did not last longer than 4 months
Good higher end business casual pants that fit true to size.
Wonderful Fit! Men's haggar's. Great Quality!!!
Super comfortable, but very disappointing; rips in the crotch in less than 2 months
Expandable waist for my expandable waist
customerReviewBodies: A

This review is for the Haggar Men's Premium No Iron Expandable Waist Plain Front Pant in the Classic Fit. I was looking for a business casual pant that was a small step up from my 100% cotton Izod Men's American Chinos that I've been wearing for years and these Haggar pants fit the bill.

I normally take a 40W 30L pant and these Haggar pants fit me true to size in those measurements. Since the fabric is a mix of 61% Cotton, 37% Polyester, 2% Spandex the cloth has a little stretch to it which is very comfortable without being too stretchy. The fabric also has a bit of a sheen compared to 100% cotton chino or khaki pants and I think this gives these pants a slightly more dressy look without being a full dress pant. The material is medium weight and fully lined and seems sturdy and well-made. The classic fit works well for me as I have larger thighs and appreciate a little extra room there.

The pants wash well and, if taken from the dryer when finished, come out smooth and sleek and need no-ironing as the name suggests.

So far, I'm very satisfied with these pants and the next step will be to see how well they hold up over time.

Bought these for my husband who loves the expandable waist band. Easy to care for, machine washable and hang to dry. They don't need ironing. Will buy this brand again and again. Fit was just as they said on the size chart.
W

Nice pants, great fabric and just as described. They fit like they were hand tailored. Easy to recommend.
Foe some scale - I'm 6'4", weigh 225lbs and am what people would say 'well proportioned.

I got these pants for working at the Oakland A's games and they were an instant hit. Not only are these great looking...they offer comfort, durability and value. We all all looking for the most bang for our buck..and these slacks didn't disappoint. All this value at such an affordable price- whats not to like?
Soon after using 1 pair a few days ,I quick ordered another. Now ,the only thing I need to do is try the other colors as well.
I

I wasn't sure if the 32' length was long enough for me (I'm 6"2) but I found it just right, resting just at my shoe top. More "break" than the modern kids seem to like, but at 43 I guess I like more "break" for my buck. These are also very comfortable. I use them as my work pants. As a banker I am up and down from my desk and walking around the office. In fact, I bought a second pair because I love them so much! Easy to clean and dry. No ironing needed. My busy family life can't afford more time for to much clothing care.

30” length turned out to be about 32”.
Hence return but speedy refund.
Really good quality as always with Haggar trousers. Purchased as a more formal going out trouser and they fit the bill superbly.
G

I already have an identical pair in a different colour, purchased the time-honoured way: I drove to an over-crowded mall, paid WAY too much for a CinnaBon and a mediocre coffee, pawed over the racks for the brand I knew I wanted, and then tried them on in a flimsy changing room that has better security provisions than my bank.
No matter what the leg length they say, the first trip after purchase is still to my tailor.
So, after a decent purchase price, avoiding the mall (and Cinnabons), and after dropping a few extra bucks on my tailor's counter, I am pleased with this purchase.

Pants are light weight , so more ideal for spring/summer . Zipper appears to be brass , so should be alright . Pockets are fairly large . I'm satisfied with the elastic as well , because it has plenty of gentle give to all four elastics (two on each side , which overlap one another with one of them hidden in the waist band ) .Purchased another style of Haggar with stretch waist band and the wide elastic which rested against you was so firm , there was almost no give at all which defeated the softer elastic hidden in the waist band . These were good .
Update ...bought a second pair .

mensPants.title: Amazon Essentials Men's Classic-Fit Wrinkle-Resistant Flat-Front Chino Pant
mensPants.description: An Amazon brand - A flat-front wrinkle-resistant dressy chino pant that offers classic style all week long

customerReviewTitles: Comfortable slacks that fit you well and hold up during the day
Great pair of casual dress pants
Remember you get what you pay for
Great value in business casual pants
Amazon Essentials have become my go-to when it comes to Wardrobe. Comfortable and affordable
I would caution everyone not to buy this product until better testing can be done on this product
Good for working where appearance doesn't matter
customerReviewBodies:
These slacks literally came ready to wear.

I didn't have to do anything to them but slip them on. They are comfortable and being wrinkle resistant they hold up over a busy day. I am up and down through the day when I am traveling for work, and these pants still look good at the end of the day. Love the way they feel and definitely like the way they look. There are several colors to choose from, and I have already order different ones to wear with various outfits.

Perfect for life on the go. These slacks are what I need to stay looking and feeling good.

These are great, if not perfect, dress slacks. I purchased the blue pair and they fit comfortable, give just enough room to be comfy and not too tight, but damn do they ever collect hairs and random bits and pieces of fluff. I have worn them a handful of times and had to run a lint collector over them twice a day to ensure I do not look like a homeless guy who walked through a petting zoo. I would not call these Wrinkle-Free but certainly Wrinkle-Resistant, by the afternoon of sitting at a desk you will have wrinkles.

I have now added the grey and khaki pants to my closet as well.
I
F

I love the look and the feel of these pants. They allow you to switch it up when it comes to your wardrobe, wearing them for casual to business casual.

The fit in the waist and the length is just what I expected. They are comfortable and affordable, which means that you can get several colors to go with your wardrobe and not worry about breaking the bank.

Label says it is 60/40 cotton/poly. In no way is there any polyester in this pants. Within 5-10 minutes of wearing the merchandise, everything starts to balloon and lose it's shape. The two pants I received are defective and possibly are intentionally meant to deceive the public.
I would caution everyone not to buy this product until better testing can be done on this product.
M

Soft, durable pants that have faded beyond all reason. We ordered black and now they're gray. I only wash in child with Tide. My son wore them to work as a server and after a month he was told he couldn't wear them anymore. If color doesn't matter, the material had held up. Good for working where appearance doesn't matter.
I

I have to start with the price...wildly cheap.
I usually pay £40-50 for my chinos from a well known online apparel company and while these trouser are not quite as good quality they are good quality especially for £19.
Things I like,
The waist fit. They fit on the waist, not above and not below it.
The material. The material, while not top quality is good quality.
The overall fit. The fit is almost exactly the same as my expensive chinos.
Apart from the slightly less robust quality of the material, the only real differences are that the company from which I normally order chinos tailor them to my exact leg length and offer waist sizes from 32inches, rising in 1 inch increments up to 44inches. Then, for up to £30 more per pair you'd expect a little something extra.
Things I don't like.
Belt loops. There are fewer belt loops on these chinos but only one fewer so I suppose I am picking nits, although, I do think it makes a difference.
Trouser cuffs. I don't like the jeans type of cuff finish. My usual chinos have traditional plain trouser cuff hems and I prefer them. Call me picky.
If closely looked at, in the places people don't see, these trousers are not as well finished as my other chinos and the material doesn't seem quite as heavy duty.
I bought these trousers to wear about the house and in the neighbourhood to save my other more expensive olive green chinos but really, I have worn and will wear them into town.
All in all, at £19 these trousers really are a steal, excellent value for money.
I rarely give five stars to anything that isn't of remarkably high quality because I think to do otherwise devalues the star rating system, however I have given these trousers five stars in the value for money category.

mensPants.title: Amazon Essentials Men's Classic-Fit Wrinkle-Resistant Stretch Dress Pant
mensPants.description:
An Amazon brand - This classic fit wrinkle-resistant stretch dress pant provides a clean, modern look perfect for any occasion

Amazon Essentials is focused on creating affordable, high-quality, and long-lasting everyday clothing you can rely on. Our line of men’s must-haves includes polo shirts, chino pants, classic-fit shorts, casual button-downs, and crew-neck tees. Our consistent sizing takes the guesswork out of shopping, and each piece is put to the test to maintain the highest standards in quality and comfort.

customerReviewTitles: Great fit but not wrinkle free
Zipper, must have been designed by a lady
very comfy, unreal comfy, bit big by the ankle
customerReviewBodies:
Definitely easy care pants. Washed on delicate, dried on low heat, removed promptly and hung up and they didn’t have a single wrinkle.
Purchased these for my son who wears 30x34 in pants. These were plenty long enough and didn’t come up too high when he sat down. He’s an athlete with muscular legs and the leg openings are just right, not skinny leg cut nor loose or baggy either.
Very nice looking dress pants. Very pleased with my purchase.
O

Not as wrinkle-free as I expected. After steaming them and putting away after use, I found them wrinkled again two weeks later. I ironed the pants and hopefully they stay that way. Otherwise, great fit and I enjoy the light weight feel with summer approaching.
For a man it has 2 functions, if it does not go down far enough its very hard to take a whiz... It cannot stop mid length, SMH.... Other than that this would be a 5 star review.

If you're looking for nice affordable, but sturdy and comfortable pants, look no further.

Got me 2 pairs of these on primeday and I'm loving them!

I never thought I would find something of this quality for the right price!

I received this pair of pants quickly and felt great. The reason it is ranked 3 stars on the review is Because the pants barely lasted a single month before falling apart along the seams. If you plan on wearing these pants 2-3 times a week, I highly recommend looking elsewhere.
M
G

These were bought for my husband and they are a perfect fit. It was good to find trousers with an inside leg measurement of 30 inches. Normally, only 29, 31 or 33 inches are available. It's a pity there aren't more colours available.
A little baggy but okay. Material is good

Ya he comprado pantalones tipo chinos de esta marca y en ese caso quedaron a la perfección sin necesidad de ajustes.

Esta enorme, para nada como de ve en la foto. Queríamos regresarlo pero se nos fue el tiempo para hacerlo.

Me gusta el precio y la calidad, lo que no me gusto es que este pantalón color azul es de un corte más amplio use el gris y el negro.

mensPants.title: Amazon Essentials Men's Slim-Fit Wrinkle-Resistant Flat-Front Chino Pant
mensPants.description: An Amazon brand - This slim-fit chino pant features wrinkle-free fabric, a flat-front design, and button-through back welt pockets for a tailored look and all-day comfort

customerReviewTitles: “New to you” pants or Alexa’s dirty clothes.
Got these for my picky college-bound son. He loves them!
customerReviewBodies: I
These made me look good on the most important day of my life... my birthday
O
A

I ordered these in navy first to get a feel for the sizing, which is absolutely perfect. After getting them and liking them so much I ordered them in two other colors (grey and black) which were also perfect fitting. However after wearing these for work and washing them, the navy has faded terribly above the knee up to the waist and are unwearable without looking tacky. The other colors survived though but I will be very cautious when washing them in the future.

Since my son is off to college in a few days, we ordered him a bunch of desperately needed new clothes. We ordered several different kinds of "slim fit" pants, including some designer ones that were MUCH more expensive than these.

Of all the pants we got him (about 12 pairs and 5 different brands), the only ones he really liked, fit-wise, were these! They drape well, don't bunch in weird places, and keep their shape even when washed in hot water and dried at top heat. They look great on him, and the details, seams, etc. are very well made.

Can't go wrong with these, is the gist of it.
I
I

I tried a few different sizes of these trousers and eventually settled on 34/29. I initially ordered in my usual jeans size (32/30) but were way too tight in the waist and a little long in length. My advice therefore is to order your normal trouser size not jean size. There is no adjustment or stretch in the material. The light grey colour looks smart. They are made of an extremely comfortable lighter weight material - great for the summer. I am very pleased with these trousers and they are amazing for the price. The only negative comment I would make is that I would not describe them as wrinkle resistant. Highly recommended but be careful with the sizing.

Really nice trousers for the price that fit beautifully. Better yet, they have the rarest of sizes - the elusive 35” waist for blokes who are happy to put it away at Christmas but aren’t yet ready to admit they’re 36s. The only issue - and it’s quite a big one - is that you cannot get the colour you ordered: I ordered navy… taupe arrived. I kept them as they are, as I said above, great trousers and - who knows? - Putin is being a muppet and I might need to go camo. I ordered navy again… taupe arrived… again. I sent them back, without any trouble, and ordered navy. It was a matter of principle now. Who wants two taupes? I wanted my mundane blue work trousers, not a colour that would have a colleague shouting, “All right, chinos?!” at me across the premises. Certainly not twice a week. Anyway… black has just arrived and I admit defeat. I’ll keep them though. As I have mentioned a few times, they really are very nice trousers for the price.

I'm going to try to iron them out, but wear them even with a bit of a crease, but with regrets. Not sure yet whether I'd buy another pair, but the price is amazing to try them out.

Overall I think these are pretty good pants. The fit seemed right on at my standard size, the material is comfortable and seems durable enough... BUT they have one flaw that drives me nuts! The pockets are way to shallow. I have the standard fit ones as well and the pocket on those is much deeper. I can’t sit down with anything of reasonable size in my pocket without it falling out. They length wise they were great. The waist size didn't fit my son but I knew it was a chance it wouldn't. We ordered several sizes. He fits the 32X34. He 5'11 and 135 lbs. OK I'M DOWNGRADING MY ORIGINAL REVIEW....
After just a few weeks they already they look old, FADED and very cheap.

I've worn and washed these navy chinos about 7 times since I bought them a few weeks ago.
The navy colour has quickly faded in the sun and from washing.
In places they have turned a noticeably reddish-brown colour - really horrible looking.
After 7 washes they were so faded as to be unwearable so this week I had to dye them navy again using fabric dye.

The synthetic fibers also makes them extremely scratchy and itchy in warm weather.
And they also shrunk a bit after just 6 washes at 30 degrees.
They were £26 so lesson learned - you get what you pay for!

These have turned out to be nicer than expected.

I basically bought them as a very cheap 'wear a couple of times' pair of trousers, but I'm quite impressed with the quality.

In the photo they look very 'shiny' and plasticky, but in reality, they are 60% cotton and are indistinguishable from expensive Chinos. (Photo).

They are a lightweight material. So definitely more suited to summer than winter.

I ordered a 36inch waist and 30 leg and the fit is good.

The trousers themselves are nicely made, all seams and buttons are nicely sewn, with no hanging threads.

Overall, for the money, these are great value, and I would happily buy again.

I hope you found this review helpful.

customerReviewBodies: I wanted smooth, woven, lightweight cotton pajama pants. These are plain cotton in, let's face it, consertvative prints of stripes and plaids. Which I like. I'm just above the upper height for "normal" women's sizes at 5' 8"; these are just a bit long on me, coming to about the bottom of my heel. Fine for me for sleeping but shorter people will want to shorten them up a bit. I was expecting to have to sew the fly shut, but actually the one button keeps it closed modestly. They also have pockets. Now I can't imagine what men keep in their pajama pockets, but since women aren't allowed to have pockets in just about anything (world domination threat, perhaps?) I feel honored to have them. They fit just fine and have a cinchable tie at the waist if you need it. They're not exotic or "sexy" but are great to sleep in, pad around the house in, and help keep your legs a bit warmer when letting the dog out one last time before bed.

Just loving these, hoping for more unusual and interesting patterns as the Palm Tree ones are just awesome. The Plaid and stripes are of course fine too. .. Color is thru, other PJs I have are white inside, these are not.

customerReviewBodies: I

Guys, I always try to be as critical as I can when I write a review, but I just cannot find anything wrong with these pants! I'm 5'10" and weigh 225 lbs. and as a "Gym rat" I have a devil of a time finding dress slacks for work which will accommodate my 36 in. waist with my thunder-thighs (I never missed out on Leg Day). I was concerned with this when I ordered these pants, so I ordered one waist size larger than normal (I ordered 38 x 30's). The fit was perfect for me, as I like my pants loose fitting. Not only was there plenty of room in the thigh portion of the pants, but my private parts were not smashed or split down the middle by the inseam stitches like I get when I order Dockers or Land's End slacks. It seems that the fashion today for slacks is for them to ride low on the waist and have a slim, straight leg. Call me old-fashioned but I'm more concerned with comfort than style. The material was not skimped on, as these pants were thick yet breathable. They are dyed quite well, because after the first wash, there was no bleeding of color. I am extremely happy with my purchase and will continue to buy more of these!

The 5-star rating is really more for the $20 price tag than anything else. They are truly a bargain, although if you're accustomed to wearing more expensive khaki-type pants, like Dockers for example, that are heavy cloth and have a hard finish with some sheen, you may not be crazy about these. I'm an attorney, and I often wear them to the courthouse with a coat and tie, and they look just fine. The pockets are deep and the pants are comfortable and well-made, just know that the fabric is somewhat basic. For $20, they're still a deal!
I

These pants are made of a coarse, almost rag-like material. They catch lint from the washer and dryer like no other clothes I’ve ever had. They look drab after the first wash. Are not permanent press, nor wrinkle-free. Finally, they run long in the pant leg.

I never return clothes, but had to send these back. $20 pants are better quality from Marshalls, TJ Max, or similar.
I purchased five pairs of khaki pants for school uniforms for my son. The fit was perfect, with room to grow and few wrinkles. I highly recommend these pants.
I

I knew I was taking a chance with these. Some reviewers praised the product, others trashed them. I needed new pants and didn't want to spend a lot, so I figured, "what have I got to lose?" I ordered two pairs, two different colors, but both the same size. I had hoped, based on the reviews here, that at least one of the pairs would work, but no such luck. The blue ones were ok in the waist, but for some reason were really tight in the seat. I am afraid they might split if I bend over. The tan ones (remember, same size, supposedly) I couldn't button up. Both are going back. I suppose I could order a larger size, but I shouldn't have to; I know what size pants I wear. Guess I will have to bite the bullet and order more expensive name brand pants.
They fit, they're pretty well made, the price is low, they suit office work and casual settings, they don't look cheap next to my expensive trousers. They're just . . . trousers. Good all-rounders.

I

LEE Men’s Performance Series Extreme Comfort Pant. A classic khaki look built for maximum comfort and style. Available in a variety of colors.



Overall Fit: Straight fit pant.

Just like our founder, H.D. Lee, our passion is helping can-do people do more. We are committed to designing clothing that conforms to your body, allowing you to move through life freely. Move your Lee.

customerReviewBodies: I was super excited when I first put these on because they fit perfectly and we're extremely comfortable however as soon as I put my hands in my pockets and then realized that the bottoms of the pockets were torn completely out I was very disappointed. They used the cheapest material ever created by mankind for the pockets. It's like bad swimsuit material that has been sitting in the sun too long.. I don't know why they would put such a horrible material for a pocket where you going to put keys and a pocket knife and change and all kind of stuff..
I

These pants are very comfortable. My first impression was that they were a perfect fit, amazingly flexible and comfortable, and the only issue was maybe how much of a lint magnet they were. I already had a lint roller handy whenever getting ready for work, so the lint was never a big deal for me. What did worry me were all the loose threads present in the pants. On the first pair I found many seams that just weren't the same quality between the pairs I ordered and at the end, I figured out that I needed a longer leg length and reordered.

In the next batch I received one right out of the box that had a pocket ripped in two sides. Interestingly enough, the pockets are made of a stretchy mesh that is sewn in the center and when you pull them inside out and tug on both sides, you can see the mesh struggle against that thread. This worried me with my other pairs when I inspected them and before another month had passed I already had another hole in my pocket where I keep my keys.

It's a shame because the material used in the pockets is very comfortable, like the rest of the pants, just not very durable or reliable. I believe the pockets in these pants will fail ages before everything else and I need to be able to rely on them not to fail me so I chose to return my third set of pants back in the end. I'd understand a pocket rip maybe after a year(s) of use but within a month of my purchase is far too flimsy.

Okay, so I’ve reached the age (and, if I’m being honest, size) where a little stretch/flexibility is appealing. I recently discovered the American Eagle Extreme Flex jeans, so I set out in search of dress pants that had the same comfort and flexibility.

I stumbled across these pants and decided to give them a try— especially at such a great price. I was not disappointed. They have a modem fit, and they’re comfortable.

I will say that they’re not dressy. These are much more casual khakis, but I was able to pull them off by pairing them with a collared shirt and casual loafers in a business casual office.

I often fear that “flex” pants will make me look like I’m wearing pajamas with pockets, but these don’t. They look just like a normal pair of casual khakis, but with MUCH more comfort. If Lee’s releases more colors, I’ll definitely order more!

It is extremely rare to find pants that are 1 - comfortable, 2 - priced very well and 3 - have the length FIT! Most of my life I’ve had to alter pants after purchasing. So purchase pants for $40 and get them altered (max) $20 = $60 for 1 pair of pants. It’s hard enough competing against taller men for job, promotions, etc because humans always, instinctually, choose a taller guy because it signifies strength, leadership, etc. Then add “insult to injury” having a closet of altered pants that must get thrown away after “its time” because no one buys altered pants. Enough of that. These pants are nice enough to add a sport shirt and a jacket for any business casual event. Having a 28” inseam means I can wear them without altering. What an amazing concept! Not to mention these pants are comfortable, extremely comfortable. However, try these for yourself. Especially if you are 5’ 4” tall and COVID left you ~30lbs heavier. You’ll be surprised at the comfort and ability to dress up or down (polo, or simply a tee shirt, boots and a beverage).

So I’ve bought these pants multiple times for work in the past. The quality has slowly gotten worse and worse. The first pair i got 2 years ago lasted me a full year, working as a mechanic I was very impressed, they also fit super comfy. The next pair I got was about a year ago, they were still decent but only lasted about 6-8 months before the back ripped at the belt loop area and outside the back pockets.. I figured it was something I did . So I ordered another pair yesterday.. these are COMPLETELY different. The material is MUCH thinner, the price has gone up ever so slightly yet the quality has dropped by a long shot. I have no choice but to keep them bc I need them for work but.. i have a bad feeling they will not last a month being so thin and scrappy stitching . Very disappointed as i used to love these so much.

The waist is "elasticated" all the way round and not just at the sides so does not have that restricted feel when buttoning at the front. The amount of "give" in the waist is just perfect for comfort. The material is good quality with the pocket sizes being practical. I have ordered two other pairs of different colours. As these jeans are imported from the US delivery time is a bit longer but well worth the wait

My husband and son are both engineers and they love the comfort and flexibility these trousers provide, they have also found that they were able to wear a size down for a more snug fit around the hips due to the stretch although their real size fits well with a slightly more relaxed look. They are smart and wash up well with minimal to no ironing required so I am happy too. Highly recommend this garment for work and leisure as they are smart enough for every day wear too. Excellent product, delivery and service.
Product fits great, feels nice, good value for this brand, will buy again in different colours. Winner.
Nothing to dislike. Great fit, comfort and value.
Comfortable to wear although smaller size would have been better for me.

customerReviewTitles: Slimmer than 502s, still more relaxed than the 512s.
Chinos are super popular in general and these are super comfortable and high quality.
customerReviewBodies: I am what my wife likes to call...picky. About everything. I also hate shopping. I have been on the search for comfortable pants to wear to work for years. They either don't fir right, are uncomfortable, or are so baggy at the ankle I could fit both legs through. Gave these a shot and they are darn near perfect. Super comfortable. Fit well, and have a nice taper at the ankle. I immediately went back and ordered every color that was in stock. Found my new go-to pant, which means that they will immediately be discontinued.

I'm a huge fan of the Levi's 502 Regular Tapered jeans (seriously, it's the only denim I buy anymore). So, when I saw these were on sale with the same naming convention (minus the explicit 502 designation), I was expecting the same fit. While they're certainly not skinny jeans, these are probably a midway point between the 502 Regular Tapered fit and the 512 Slim Tapered, which are too tight for my liking. So, be prepared that these will be a bit more snug than the 502s.

I ordered these for work. Chinos are great for my line of work. Nowhere in the description page of these pants, does it state insulated or warm. Received and noticed a thick material. Read the label and it states "warm." Further in it states "to keep heat in." You see... I live in Souther Florida. Staying warm is not exactly an issue we have around here. Would have been nice to know in the description, that these are for cold weather conditions. 1 star based on lack of description and the fact I am being inconvenienced now, to return the item.

customerReviewTitles: Wrangler, Levi's, and Lee's comparison roundup
Real jeans for those who work hard, and play hard!
Thought I was a "regular" guy but apparently not
customerReviewBodies:
I bought a pair each of regular fit, straight leg, zipper fly Levi's, Lee, and Wrangler jeans. The Levi's(505) were $40, the Lee's $32, and the Wrangler's $20. I washed all of them once, in cold water. They all fit about the same. The construction seems to be about the same too. All had 5 belt loops and reinforced the same points. They all were about the same weight denin. One difference I could find was that the Levi's had two rivets on the coin pocket while the Lee's and Wranglers had one rivet there and sewed the other side of the coin pocket into the main pocket seam. Also, the Levi's print your jean size on the outside label, while the Lee's and Wranglers do not. Both the Levi's and Lee have a double stitched external inseam on the inside of the legs and a concealed inseam on the outside of the legs. The Wranglers reversed this with the concealed inseam on the inside and a double stitched seam on the outside. The length of the inseam, compared to the advertised length, was pretty close, with the Lee's being the longest, and the Wranglers the shortest.

Overall, I would say they all three pairs look like they will be fine over the longer term. So perhaps the price difference and your preference for brands might be the deciding factor.

A couple of preliminaries here. I was friends with someone that used to work at a factory that would sew different name brands on the same clothing before even that factory went overseas. So I'm less addicted to the name of a product line than a particular product that is made at the time. I've worn well and far over a hundred jeans (dungarees for the less metrosexual of us over my far too many years). The only jean that I ever cried over was a very expensive Italian dress jean purchased years ago at Neiman Marcus. For those, they were the most elegant, comfortable and good looking jeans that heaven an Italian weaver gave to us. Ambrosia for the skin. For jeans under 90 dollars I've found in general that some of the Wranglers have been truer to size than most others. Yes, they are more coarse, and I understand that someone would be pissed that they received a jean that had a belt loop improperly sewed but this same person worked for a high end retail chain that had to return about 10% of the expensive high-end jeans for defects before being placed on the sales floor. Even then inconsistent sizing was an issue. Barring someone's fascination with the name of a clothing line, with few exceptions I really don't see much of a difference in quality between this 7 loop jean and a jean costing twice or more from other manufacturers including some (which is an irritant) from this same company. Unless someone is looking for a particular type of fit IMO the price justifies the purchase of this jean. I can beat the hell out of it, tear it up, put holes in it and not cry about it because 19 bucks for a decent fitting jean is CHEAP in this market. So what if there may be a defect in it. Return it and get another one. For me that's easier to stomach than having to return one costing much more and having to worry how much wear I'll get out of it. Cheap is good sometimes and not an exact indicator of quality. When I've done heavy duty work that puts more wear & tear pressure on the jean I've tended towards Carhartt. Great jean for wear & tear but an uncomfortable fit (for me) for every day casual & light work wear. As far as shrinkage goes, I wash all my clothing in cold water or dry clean it so I've never had a problem. How someone can wash anything cotton, whether Sanforized or not in hot water and not expect an issue is beyond me.

I have purchased these in two colors and love them both. These Wranglers are heavy weight 100% cotton denim jeans. No spandex here! They are old school work hard and play hard jeans made the way denim jeans are meant to be made! Wranglers are comfortable, high quality denim with enough belt loops to allow your belt to work properly. They are big enough in the cuff to easily slip down over cowboy style boots without having to purchase a "boot cut" jean. The pockets are all deep enough to actually be useful. The cut and fit allow for all day comfort and ease of movement when walking, sitting, squatting, kneeling, and bending. Lastly, Wrangler offers enough colors to allow for personal preference, and also allow you to wear them as dressier occasion jeans when required. I used to wear the other two big name brand jeans but both started using thin denim with spandex in the weave, and they also deleted a couple of belt loops for some reason. Unlike these Wrangler Jean's they just aren't built for real work anymore. The other two makers lost a customer because unfortunately, as with most things nowadays, the price went up, and the quality came down. These Wranglers are my new favorites and as long as they don't change them they will have a loyal customer for life!

I'm not sure who these "Regular Fit" jeans are intended for, but I think if you have any semblance of a butt or something other than pipe cleaners for thighs, I don't you'll be happy with these. These jeans had no room in the butt, through the thighs or in the crotch. And before we think that I had picked up the wrong size, I'll say that the waist was fine or every a little loose. Good news is that there's also a "Relaxed Fit" version of these jeans from Wrangler and they're the same $20. Those worked for me just fine (except they are a little long) and for $20 you can hardly go wrong. These are good looking, comfortable jeans offered in a number of different colors.

UPDATE:
I've been wearing them every day, and washing every other. Today, fresh out of a very hot dryer, they fit PERFECT!!! Can't tell you how happy I am with these jeans. At this price, I went and bought more, and perhaps my best friend ordered for me as well, since I hit my limit of three. (wink/nod)

Can't find this size in stores, so I usually end up having to get them longer and hem them. I don't sew real good, so I have never had a Jean that fit perfect off the shelf. I am elated!!! Thanks Wrangler!

I bought the genuine classic cut that is 100% cotton. I bought one pair just to see if they worked for me. I have worn them all day and they are quite comfortable. These aren't hip huggers, but they do ride low on the waist, as advertised. I'll update if something changes after a month or so.

So, as I understand it "Wrangler Authentics" are not genuine "Wranglers" but a close copy. Though I know this only from other reports here. My experience of my first pair would tend to confirm this. They look good and feel good as Wranglers but shape and feel do not last as long as the "genuine" article. But the fit and cut are so close as to make little difference and the price makes them an affordable copy whereas the cost of the "genuine" article is currently out of my budget reach. So buy with confidence but remember these may not be the genuine article.....

customerReviewBodies: I have been a huge fan of dockers dress pants for the last 10 years. However, I am suddenly finding it very difficult to locate 100% cotton pants. My husband's favorite pants used to be Haggar Work to Weekend Hidden Expandable Waist, but when we ordered them recently, he noticed the liner in the pocket was white (not matching the color of the pants) and was very noticeable when sitting. Thus began the hunt for a new brand of expandable waist pants with pocket liners that were the same color as the pants, or at least not white and close to the pocket opening. As mentioned, these do have a white liner but with enough of the actual pants material going inside the pocket to make it barely noticeable. If this is important to you, another brand we just tried has a black liner which is much preferred over the white (Land's End Men's Comfort Waist) which also offers free hemming or cuffing in 1/4 inch increments.

I live in South Florida where the heat and humidity are a factor in clothing selection. These Dockers are very comfortable for all day wear both inside and out. Two weeks in, the clasp to the zipper hasn't broken off yet, but I'm expecting it to, at any moment. In addition, I've never worn pants before where the front pockets are firmly placed at the side of the legs, rather than at least somewhat near the front. A bit bizarre, but not a deal breaker. I'm going to have to gush. Over pants, no less. I've been wearing these daily for one month and six days. These pants are fantastic. They quit the dryer ready to wear (no ironing required), they look hyper professional, they fall well across the crotch (no tents, even when seated), they are super soft, and they come in a variety of fabric weights.

Thus far, I own two Dark Charcoal Heathers (Stretch) and one pair of the Dark Pebble (Stretch). The dark charcoal are a heavy weight (flannel-esque) fabric that kept me super warm commuting over winter (40s F by day, 10s F by night). The dark pebble are lighter weight, if still substantial, and should serve well across the summer (80s and 90s F by day, 40s and 50s F by night). The pants are roomy, and the crotch is cut high enough, my thighs don't "meet" each other when I am on the run (a pet peeve of mine in other makes; going thigh-to-thigh irritates me when both thighs are mine).

I have had no breathability issues to date across long meetings in over-warm boardrooms, in either pair. It is (literally) 83 F in my office as I pen this (if a lovely 58 F outside), and the dark charcoal remain comfortable, temperature (and every other) wise. As such, I am inclined to test them (dark charcoal) across the summer; they look that sharp.

I am a 38x32 at present, and the fit was true to size for all three pairs that I've ordered; again, thus far. I see myself buying new and backup colors as soon as my lesser pants are decommissioned. I can grab stuff off the floor without having to readjust and re-tuck after, and I can sit (seemingly) indefinitely with no waist pressure/discomfort. I will continue to purchase and enjoy these for as long as they sell them (and do not alter them). Even if my size varies over time, the magic waistband stretches 2-3 inches without deforming the lay of the pant. Moreover, it shrinks a little beyond the listed size, not just grows, so I can continue to enjoy them whatever direction my diet and exercise bear out.

Bottom line... Love at first sit !!!

Alright, so I'm an IT guy, and a flexible one at that. I'm constantly squatting, bending down, crawling, and getting into some not-so-accomodating places. These pants are GREAT. The stretch that's built into them feels great when you're doing a lot of work as they don't feel stressed, too tight, or like they're going to rip. I've worn down and destroyed a lot of pants through constant wear and tear, and I've been looking for a pair of khakis that are stylish, fairly slim fitting, while still allowing a high level of athleticism without falling to pieces. These have done exceptionally well and I cannot recommend them enough to anyone who needs a good pair of khakis that will let you get down and dirty without breaking.

I hate buying new pants. It's the worst. I also hate pants in general. I find them very constricting - I move around a lot, am very flexible, and like to have a solid range of motion. Pants always seem to stop me from moving my legs the way I want to. Well, without ripping the pants. I saw the "Smart 360 Flex" on these pants, read a little about it, thought they sounded good, and figured I'd give them a try. I ordered them, they came in, I put them on, and I promptly ordered three more pairs in different colors. These are the most comfortable dress pants in the history of time. They look both from a distance and upon closer inspection like normal dress khakis. But they feel like you're wearing pajama pants. You can move however you want in them and they stretch very naturally to your every movement. They fit perfectly as expected, not too tight, super comfortably, and move however you want. All while looking perfectly professional. Plus, they have one of the smoothest zippers on the fly ever. Love a smooth zipper fly. Hate clunky ones that lead to you standing at a urinal, zipper gets caught, you have to move it back and forth a few times to free it, meanwhile you look like a creep in the middle of the bathroom. Never gonna happen with these pants. They also have a weird security pocket on the side of the right pocket. For people that use them, I'm sure it's a great feature. For people that don't (like me), it's practically unnoticeable so it's a non-issue. And far better than those stupid security pockets that some pants have inside the regular pocket, like a pocket in a pocket, which always just led to my keys getting stuck in them and me having to turn out the entire pocket just to get them out. So this is a much better solution.

Long story short - Professional looking khakis that feel like pajama pants. Best damn dress khakis ever.

mensPants.description: Elevate your island-inspired style with a pair of handcrafted linen pants. customerReviewTitles: Comfortable without bagginess, and suitable for the office

customerReviewBodies:
Finally! Every summer for the past few (maybe several) years, I've gone looking for some linen or linen blend dress pants. Something I could wear to the office on these 90+ degree days here along the Gulf Coast. And every year I would get frustrated and give up after sifting through an abundance of baggy, drawstring-waisted, beach pants. I might find one or two offerings from some high end brands, but at eye-watering prices.

Not this year, though. I finally found exactly what I was looking for: cool, comfortable linen blend pants that are appropriate for work and pair well with a sportcoat or blazer, and which are not priced like a new suit.

Fit: slightly tailored but without being tight. I've got somewhat thick thighs for my waist size, which means I often try on pants that fit beautifully as long as I remain standing and then become uncomfortably tight around the quads the moment I sit down. These pants pass the all-important sitting test, which so many others fail. The legs hang fairly straight below the knee with a medium break at the ankle when ordered in my usual length. After a wash or two, I did notice a small amount of shrinkage, but not enough to significantly alter the fit. For reference, I am 6'0", 185lbs and typically wear 34W x 34L, which is what I ordered here.

Color: I have two pair, one in navy blue and one in "natural" linen. The natural pair is a fairly light color, darker than off-white, but not by much, and certainly lighter than tan. Think unbleached paper cone coffee filter. The coloring has a little bit of natural variation. The navy pair, however, has an even and consistent color throughout that tends to mask the texture of the fabric unless seen up close, so the pants aren't obviously linen when seen from more than a few feet away.

Care: Since these are dress pants, you won't want to go with the crumpled look of casual linen beach wear. And that means you do have to iron them a bit as they'll come out of the dryer looking a little shriveled on the legs. A few touches with an iron set on high is all it takes to flatten out any major wrinkles, though, and the rest seems to fall into place.

These pants are light and airy, just what I needed for attending outdoor summer weddings in 90 degree weather. The fit was just right. They fit just like a pair of dress pants, not baggy like some of the beach style linen pants. After one washing there was no noticeable shrinkage, but of course they are linen and may at some point and came out very wrinkled. A few minutes with an iron while they were still damp and they are good to go. I typically wear 36-38 waist pants depending on brand and style (OK and how much weight I’ve gained or lost too), and 32 inseam. These hit the tops of my shoes just like my dress pants, and the waist is true to size to me.
T

I've been a 32 w 34 l for many years, the first pair I ordered was much too small at the waist and much too long in the inseam. Happily, I had time to order a pair in a 34 w 32 inseam that fit just great. These slas are well made and look great, I would not hesitate to purchase them again.

customerReviewBodies: Love these pants! I ordered the 34x32, and I'm 6'0", and around 200 lbs. They are super comfortable and stylish, hold up well against wrinkling, are cool and breathable, and the fit is spot on. My weight fluctuates a bit from 195-205 every few weeks, so having a waistline that expands and contracts is fantastic. It keeps me from having wasted clothing just hanging in my closet. I ordered 2 of them, and they are identical. Color and fabric has held up perfectly after 6 months of weekly machine wash on cold/tap cold and machine dry on normal. Never need to iron them, so long as you take them out of the dryer promptly and hang them up properly. My only gripe (which is minor, at that) is the little pocket inside the front right pocket. I imagine it's for pocket watches. I tried keeping my Zippo in it, but it's a pain trying to get it out. A watch on a chain would probably come out easily. Definitely recommend these pants!

My husband loved these pants. I am used to purchasing trousers for my husband and can spend $200+ on one pair. I thought I would give this a try since they were free returns. I couldn't imagine that a pair of trousers could cost under $30 and look lovely, as well. I was wrong!! These pants looked fabulous. The material was lovely and fit him nicely. They won't shine like a designer-made or hand-tailored high end pair of trousers, however, they look lovely and are well made. I haven't had them laundered/dry cleaners, yet, so we will see how they stand up to the demands of a busy executive and entrepreneur.

UPDATE: It’s been over two(2)years now and these trousers are in fabulous condition, still!! Had them to the dry cleaners and perfectly laundered!! Enjoy!!

This is the quality material, workmanship, comfortability - and affordablity that pants used to have. I work at a hotel doing room-service, and have been in hospitality for 40 years. I haven't been able to find pants like this for well over a decade. IF I wear high-end or expensive slacks, I have to deal with the hastle of drycleaning. These pants are comfortable, have a permanent crease, & do Not wrinkle (with reasonable care). (In other words don't just mash them in the bottom of your closet under 50 lbs of dirty clothes). I can wash them 3 times a week - or more if need be. Just tumble dry until "almost dry", and place on hanger - good to go. I am going to order 3 or 4 more pair. If you need pants that are practical, yet look VERY respectable -- these are the pants you need - hands down!

WOW! I LOVE these pants. I should start by saying that I don't really need the expandable waist feature, but I spend about 8 hours a day sitting at a desk and another 2-3 walking from meeting to meeting so pants that "adapt" to my posture- HUGE PLUS. They fit perfectly- absolutely true to size. I have thin legs, but there is plenty of room for more generous stems. Material, although 100% polyester, feels exceptional. Very "soft" and fine. It does not have the feel of polyester that will pill and look shabby in a month. Pockets are deep. Belt loops, seams and three-point fastening waistline (2 buttons and hook) are all of excellent quality. Another plus- You might have to crumple them under a car tire for a week or two to make a wrinkle. I love cotton and wool, but the ironing- ARGH! ...and the cost for wool- double ARGH! The Repreve Stria pants truly resist wrinkling and creasing. HOWEVER-- Be careful to NOT tumble dry if you wash at home. They will wrinkle in the dryer. Hang dry instead (my recommendation).

I now own these pants in five different colors and wear them at least three days and have been doing so for well over a year. ALL are performing beautifully! No pilling. No fading. No failed stitching. They look near-new even after dozens of machine washes.

Bottom Line- if you can get these pants for under $20 like I did, but 10 pair! At $35, buy 3 or 4 staples and I believe you will love them as I do.

The pants washed perfectly per the instructions and needed no pressing if whisked immediately from the dryer and hung. (I'm careful not to overdry polyester.) I think this trouser is excellent value for the money and Dad was happy.

First, it's Carhartt. So at least there is ONE brand that has consistent fit. It's heavier and more durable than most brands, which is why you buy Carhartt. That being said, anyone that buys Carhartt knows that they use "true sizing". Just like their "Original Fit" Shirts, these aren't for you if you favor fitted shirts and skinny jeans...THANK the gods. Your regular fashion jeans size is not going to fit you in a Carhartt pair of pants. If you are actually a 46x30, order a 46x30. Not the 40-42x32 Wranglers. (Cuz that's what I wear, ;) That extra 2" in length for a Carhartt will look awful and be very long in these pants and that 42 waist will be very very tight.
So, these pants ( I ordered the Dark Khaki, 46x30) have a mid rise waist with plenty of room in the leg (clearly, I'm a big guy) and are perfect in length. They are well constructed and the pockets don't show the liner ( I hate that in a pair of pants). They pass the "office" test, if you're like me and can't wear 'Jeans" to work, but they are plenty durable for field work (if you're like me and have to go back and forth to the job site) So, all in all, a win. ... now if they would just drop the price of the other colors for us fat dudes, I'd be happy.

I was a little sceptical of the look of the material, afraid it was going to feel like wearing a schooner sail for pants. While thick, it is still soft and comfortable. I'd kind of like them to go full casual and lose the little pocket, but that said, they feel like I'll have these around for a while.

Son loves these because:
-He has short, muscular legs and a trim belly and butt.
-Most other pants with room for his big thighs (weightlifter), have far too much room in seat and waist.
-Carhardtt tough so they won't rip in the crotch from his active work (bending, lifting, carrying, squatting)
-They look VERY nice -wear for many situations...great cloth and drape
-We bought extras!
Excellent quality and comfort.

The way these pants ended up fitting me is actually not easy to explain in 2-3 words. I've been buying 32W-34L pants for the past 10 years, but after reading the reviews on these Carhartts, and concluding that I could very well be a half inch shorter than I was when I was 40, I decided to go with 32W-32L, and they fit perfectly in the length. The waist was actually just about right, but what was odd was that the butt and thighs were tighter than I've ever come across in what are supposed to be "relaxed fit" pants. They're not uncomfortably tight, and they did loosen up a bit like cotton is prone to do after a day of wearing them, but I would definitely not describe them as relaxed fit.
From a quality standpoint, I thought they were very well made. The fabric is reasonably heavy, but doesn't feel like you're wearing pants made out of canvas. The stitching is tight, no loose threads, the zipper and top button are high quality.
The phone pocket is actually quite useful, though I use an iphone SE so I can't comment on how large a phone it would hold.
All in all, I'm very satisfied with these pants, and I certainly can't complain about the shipping- I placed my order on a Friday morning, and by Monday afternoon they were at my door, and that was with regular shipping.

Now that I finally received them they are definitely as advertised. I don’t know why people were saying they fit small. 33 waist is accurate, but the length is a little longer. If you are usually a 32 length you’ll want a 30.

The only work pants I trust are the ones made by Carhartt, I work in a Sawmill in all types of conditions. Quick wash and dry, they look like new!! They fit properly where it matters most! True fit sizing, these ones are great for Summer and fall application
Strong material build as usual with the Carhartt brand. But the relaxed fit is a bit on the large size for a 34 34.
Fit small on waist & leg width. Typically where 34/36”. Fit was more a 32”
Great style, but way smaller than had we bought in a store. A 36 fits like a 32.

This is a very comfortable pair of khakis that I wear for both work and going out. I'm about 175 cm and 66 kg, and this sizing fits great. I've had this pair for several months and it washes well in the washing machine without noticeable lost in it's shape. I've never had the need to iron the pants as long as I hang it immediately after washing. However, without ironing, the crease line does become less prominent with time, as would be expected. Some stitiching have come loose at the pockets in this pair, but this is not a problem for me. Overall, this pair of pants has held up well. The photos included were taken recently. I've bought a second pair and no stitching has come loose. I'm looking at buying a 3rd pair.

I ordered five of these at once to cycle out older pants. They are 100% cotton, which is a hard feature to find now that elastane has taken over the world. The material is a good weight, not too heavy or too light. They are nice-looking office chinos that actually feel on the slightly loose side of slim (which is good).

There are a few considerations. There are loose threads everywhere, which is common in mass produced pants. One thing that wasn't obvious from the product description is that the crease is not permanent, so if you want a crease you'll have to iron it in. Here's the really weird part: two of the five pairs had an extreme taper and the other three had a straight leg. All the tags are exactly the same, the lengths and waists are pretty consistent, and they are all made in the same country. That deducted a star from this rating. Otherwise they would be solid four-star pants.
Fits perfectly, slim cut and look.

customerReviewBodies: B

I bought these with a bit of concern about the reviews saying they shrink, but they didn’t for me. I typically wear 36x32 pants and the large-32 pants are perfect. If anything they are a touch big both in the waist and length. I assumed that they would shirk a bit when I first tried them on, but if they did I can’t tell. They are loose fitting and made of a nice lightweight material. I’m only one washing in so maybe they will shrink some in future washes. I used the gentle-permanent press cycle and hung them to dry, hitting them with an iron while still damp to reduce the wrinkles. They are linen so they wrinkle, and take a while to dry. I’d definitely buy them again.

First, I usually wear a 32" x 30" pant. That goes for dress pants, jeans, etc.

Likes -
The material feels great.
The overall quality seems good. Pockets have matching buttons, there's no loose threads, etc.

Dislike: Size -
Finding the right fit is too much of a hassle. I bought six pairs of these pants: four in Medium with 30" inseam and two in Medium with 32" inseam.

-- The first pair I got (the Medium 30" in dark blue second from top of the photo and Medium 30" in castlerock in the middle) shrunk because I washed them like normal, including hot air in the dryer. My bad.

-- The second pair I bought (Medium 30" in dark blue at the bottom of the photo pile and Medium 30" in silver (the light colored pants) I washed in a very gentle cycle with cold water and tumbled dry on the lowest heat setting. The dryer didn't matter because the pants shrunk out of the washer.

-- The latest pair (top Medium 32" in dark blue and middle Medium 32" in castlerock) are the most disappointing. The dark blue are an actual size I can wear, so I guess I'm happy about that, but the castlerock pair basically shrunk down to the size of the Medium 30" pair.

Dislike: Ability to Return -
The kicker is is that you won't find out how much shrinkage until after laundering them, so you really can't return them.

Dislike: Price -
However, I found that the price on a similar set of pants jumped from $34.99 to $41.99 the second time I bought them. How convenient.

Overall, these are probably the worst clothing purchases I've made from this site. Which is a shame, because I bought similar pants from another generic Chinese manufacturer and they're horrible. I could have lived with the initial disappointment if the two Medium 32" pairs would've come in at the correct size, but that didn't happen.

I bought these pants for an upcoming Caribbean cruise. I was a little apprehensive because some of the reviews brought up issues with them shrinking too much but with proper "break in", I didn't have any issues. Being linen, one should expect some shrinkage an the first wash and these pants are no exception. Here's the deal; order them understanding you will need time to wash, hang dry and iron them before you wear them. I normally wear a 36X30 pants so I ordered the XLX32. As soon as they arrived, I washed them in cold water with a cold rinse then hung them from the waistband and let them dry in my closet for a couple of days. They fit almost perfect! The waist is still a little larger than I would like in order to call them actually perfect but with the drawstring, they're close enough. The legs fit is amazing though. I gave them 5 stars vs 4 stars because the waist fit was my gamble and not due to an issue with the quality of the pants and they were exactly what I wanted and exactly what I expected. If you're a lose 36 waist, you may want to consider the L vs the XL. Most definitely though, try to order 2 inches taller in the inseam than what you normally wear. They WILL shrink. DO NOT PUT THESE IN THE DRYER... EVER!!!! Highly recommended for those hot summer days on the beach or by the pool.
High quality light weight trousers, very comfortable. At £39.85 including delivery and fees from the USA and arrived in only 5 days, I highly recommend buying and have already ordered another pair.

I have always been skeptical when ordering clothes on line.I was looking for a summer weight (linen) casual pair of slacks and came across several marketplace sellers.I decided to go with one pr. from each of the better names (knowing that the manufacturing was outside of U.S). OF the two pair the PERRY ELLIS pant was far superior in fit ,style and material.Linen is a great look for summer casual .These slacks will be worn for my summer touring and casual dining . They are advertised as beach pants but they are much more. I dont think I would throw this on to cover a dried out pair of swim suit. Rather wear them to the bar at poolside or a restaurant by the ocean. This pair is tied in front with a draw string but also has belt loops (which some may prefer) which I would not attempt to use as it takes away from casual look. I went with the natural (straw) color so I could have more if a selection of tops. I am right about that knowing whats in my closet...... My only concern with any linen or cotton clothing is " what will happen when cleaned (shrinkage). All linen and pure cotton clothing is advisable to hand wash in cool water , hang dry and iron at cool setting. I have not had the opportunity as of this evaluation to clean this garment. But I will follow the directions and hope for the best. Please note that I am on the thin side and feel these slacks are almost a perfect fit for a summer slacks which follow my contour and are not tight but feel very comfortable.
If I find that after a cleaning a size change such as shrinkage or thread wear occurs I will add this to my evaluation.I know I will enjoy this pair up to and hopefully after it's first cleaning.

Excelent quality.
Great!!! I recomand it!

After wearing the first pair I purchased for a few weeks, I bought a second pair and then a third. I studied apparel production and I've been sewing most of my life. It's not easy to make linen look good. It's not a stable fabric. It requires a healthy amount of reinforcing to keep pockets from sagging and waist bands from folding over. This pant has got as much of that kind of support work as I would have thought possible and a lot of meticulous top stitching to keep the waist and pocket details crisp. They are the most incredibly comfortable pants to wear, especially during our recent heat wave. When they're ironed, they're classy enough for The Great Gatsby but hot pressing isn't necessary and too much heat pressing shortens the life of linen. These look great after being hung to dry and just as good pulled out of a dryer. I only there were more colour choices.

A tale of two cities! The first order I received was a 36 x 32...they were so big a belt didn't even help much. Because I made the mistake and thought the pant work I kept them, as I was leaving for Punta Cana the next day. I wish I had returned them, but I liked the fabric and style so much, when I got home I ordered another pair...34 x 32. Figured I could sell the larger pant or give them away. The second pant I received was tight, but loose a few pounds and they would be good. This is where I really got pis-ed off! This order was a pant that had been worn before and were dirty! The tag inside said made in Indonesia and the hanging belt loop tag said made in China and no mention of "PERRY ELLIS" So I'm returning the second pant and keeping a "WAY TOO LARGE " pant, that I will donate to charity. So I'm out $70.00...don't make my mistake!!!!!!!!!!

I work a desk job and I like pants that breathe. I don't like paying $90 for pants, but considering how difficult it is to find lightweight linen pants, and how I own pants for many years before retiring them, I desecrated my piggy bank and pulled the trigger on Mr. Ellis' Personal Garb. These were purchased last year and the crotch has completely ripped out since then. They are worn maybe once or twice a week. You'd think I was doing sky-to-floor splits during those brief wearings, but no. I go to and from my desk and that was enough to completely blast away the fabric between my thighs. Practically showing off my dangling participles every time I bent over. Since then, I've had the crotch patched with a pair of similar coloured fabric but now the fabric above the knees (top thighs?) is wearing away and ripping. I'm not a hefty boy nor do I possess Hulk-like abilities, so it's the dang pants fault, not mine. For this type of quality and longevity, I'd pay $8.99. But for $90, they better last 10+ years while undergoing minimal physical exertion. OH, and THREE BUTTONS for undoing the fly!? Does the designer of these pants not understand the purpose of the fly in pants for men?? Do they like the thought of torturing the wearer knowing the struggle one must endure to undo the pants in order to relieve oneself? Can there be an option for a fly that doesn't involve masochism!? Ugh. Worst. $90 linen pants. Ever.

customerReviewBodies: I used Carhartt's size and fit guide on their website to figure out what size to get. Their size and fit guide recommended the same size I wear in another brand. So I ordered that size. When they arrived, I tried to try them on, but couldn't even comfortably pull them all the way up - they were sooo tight. So I returned them. If you order these pants, order them about 2 sizes larger than what you normally wear.

The pants are a nice material and generally a good fit, although the waist runs about 1" smaller than usual and even slightly less than stated waist measurement. The only reason I don't give these pants 5 stars is that the knees have blown out on 4 pairs I've worn for daily workwear over the past year. I suppose that comfort means some level of durability is sacrificed, but if you actually use these pants for carpentry and "work" and wash them a couple times a week, then you will need to patch the knees to make the pants last more than about 6 months.

customerReviewTitles: Yeah! These are the pants you are looking for
customerReviewBodies: With COVID-19, our company has gone to casual clothing so there's no need to wear my dress shirts, tie and wool slacks. I wanted something a little more dressy than Dockers (and their ilk) so I ordered the Haggar slacks in four colors, black, blue, grey and darker blue/grey. They fit perfectly ... it's hard to find slacks for us aging seniors that are shrinking vertically but expanding horizontally :p ... I used to be a 30x32 when I was 25, now I'm a 32-34x29 at 67. Such is life .... I'm glad to see that you can order slacks with shorter inseams; no hemming required. These slacks are "the deal", I could buy four pairs for the cost of one pair of my wool slacks. My only complaint is that out of the 5 or so pairs I've bought 3 have hab the hem on the leg come undone. It only cost me $12 each to fix so it hasn't stopped me from wearing them or even buying more pairs.

Love Haggars. Wear my others to work almost every day. I have the other ones on here that have an expandable waist so the size doesn’t have to be perfect. But I actually like these better than wool suit pants because I can throw them into the wash and they come out pretty much without any wrinkles. Makes it easy to look professional every day. I’m 6’ 215 and sometimes wear a 38 waist and sometimes a 40 (usually if I want a little extra room for my rear and legs. I went with the 38 because the reviews said that they ran a little big and were roomy. The 38’s give me plenty of room and comfort and they don’t look too large. The 31 inch length is perfect. They are are very comfortable and look fitted too.

This material seems like it will feel nice in summer. I ordered a couple sizes too big tho. A 34 was like 38. Will exchange. The waist is way stretchy. So you might need to order a size down or two.

Bought these pants as I am losing weight and am in awkward pant sizes. Some pants were fitting me too baggy and my smaller pants were too uncomfortable. These were perfect, other than the drawstring which don't fit the look for work. I bought some stretchy belts and those made these perfect. These are extremely breathable since I live in a hot state. I mainly use the black pair for work and save the colored ones for the weekend since the colors are a bit too bright for my taste. I always joke the blue ones make me look like I'm wearing scrubs. Buy one pair and try them out! Keep in mind, they shrink slightly after a wash so the fit goes from baggy when new to straight fit which is perfect for me (I have thick legs). After I bought one pair I bought two more so I don't overuse them and tear a hole in between the thighs. Overall, I am really happy with these and plan on buying more. I bought a size smaller than I am now since most reviews were saying they run big. Glad I did! They are extremely stretchy and comfortable.

These pants are awesome. My first investment in light, breathable pants for the heat down in South Florida. These have locket space, a quality zipper fly, and drawstrings to keep the waist. I absolutely love these pants. They have a button, zipper and belt loops as well as the drawstring. They are super light to wear. I got them for my trip to Florida as the weather was to be in the 90s. I used them while at the hotel relaxing and I didn’t want to wear shorts. I also used them for my trip home as I was leaving 95 degrees and going home to the mid 40 degree weather. They were perfect for being comfortable in Florida and on the flight. Yet enough to be warm back home when I landed. Definitely going to be my new favorite. Will be ordering another in black as well since white can get dirty so fast.

This line of pant is made in several Asian markets (Cambodia and Bangladesh ), and the sizing varies, as does the tailoring of the pant. You must try these on and do not assume that product within the same order are, in fact, the same pant.

I bought these pants 5 months ago, just before a leg injury that prevented me from wearing them until now. All of the labels are still on the pants - I never even unfolded them or tried them on until now. They fit fine, but there is a snag in the fabric on one leg that cannot be repaired, which I didn't not notice until now. It is too late to return them. I have several pair of these same pants in other colors and am very happy with them. This is just a warning to other buyers - examine clothing you purchase online very carefully when it arrives. This was my error for not examining the pants closely when they arrived, but I was unable to stand at the time, and had other things on my mind.

I'm a big guy, 42/44 waist. It's difficult to find a pair of pants that give me room to move around without feeling like I'm going to split my seat if I squat down to tie my shoelaces. Several years ago, the trend seemed to be moving towards "relaxed" fit, and it was nice... plenty of room in the seat and thighs, but not so much as to make it look like a clown suit. Now, with all the straight-leg and skinny-fit pants, I was ready to switch to wearing a kilt but I could never figure out what I was supposed to wear underneath.

I digress. These pants fit me great. Not only is the fit great, but I really like the fabric - they are indeed "cool" pants. Given my bulk, one would assume that I would be a big fan of adjustable waistbands. To be honest, I really don't care for them... they can be bulky and more often than not I find that they encourage my pants to fall down (even with a belt!). These slacks do have an adjustable waistband, but it's not as bad as other pants that I've owned. In my perfect world, they would make a version of these exact pants with a fixed (?) waistband, but they don't and the positives of these pants far outweigh the not-so-bad-but-still-adjustable waistband.

I've had one pair of these pants for several months and it has held up well in the wash and so far hasn't needed ironing. I would say that these pants very appropriate for a business-casual work environment (w/ shirt & tie, or button down, or polo shirt). I don't know if I'd wear them out to the bar on a Friday night the same way I would a pair of 100% cotton khakis, but that's just me.

Anyway, if you're on the stout side and you're looking for some versatile, comfortable, and affordable pants, I suggest you consider Haggar Cool 18.
