customerReviewBodies:
Fabric is soft. Color is good and hasn’t started to fade yet after several washes. Just the right amount of stretch. Very comfortable and holds my shirts in place pretty well! I want to love these pants, but I have some issues and concerns.

Non-issue:
The hidden zipper pocket makes the fabric thicker in that location. I don’t use it and it’s pointless, but it doesn’t typically get in the way so long as it’s zipped up.

Issues:
They shrink, and quite a bit, and continue to shrink.
I ordered a 34” inseam. My inseam measurements following a washer/dryer run are as follows:
34.25” no wash
32.50” one wash
32.25” two/three washes
32.00” four washes
31.75” five washes

At the current rate, another five washes and I’ll have a pair of capris!

Also, after shrinking a couple inches, ironing has become more challenging. The inseam stitch folds the wrong way about halfway down the leg. This is an annoyance because the fabric will not lay flat and promotes creasing.

I have no conclusion. If they stopped shrinking right now, I’d say order your normal waist size, but get a couple inches longer than you think. Problem is, I think it will continue to shrink. If it does, I’ll come back and update this review.

I don't understand this trend. I've tried two different brands of Chino's and they are way too tight in the crotch. I feel like the Red Sea down there! Very uncomfortable! Give us our room back people! They're also too low on the waist. I would constantly be trying to pull them up, thus making my nautical problem worse!

My new favorite chinos. Very very comfortable. They are designed to ride on your hips not 4 inches higher like so many others. Classic dockers material and styling - on the casual side. I use the zippered security pocket for my cellphone to keep my keys from scratching the screen, perfect placement. Phone doesn’t bounce when you walk like they do in a cargo pocket in fact you don’t even notice it is there it also sis a few inches higher than the deep side pockets so the screen won’t get damaged by the contents. The material is very nice but I would prefer a little more stretch. Pockets would be perfect in my opinion IF the rear pockets had zippers. Still close enough to perfect for me to go back and buy more.

I bought a pair of the blue chinos for my son and they fit well and look nice. They're a step up from jeans but not dress pants so they can be worn for both casual and slightly more formal occasions. The only thing he said was that the length was shorter by about a half of an inch than his other pants with a 32" inseam. He can still wear them but would prefer that they were a tad longer as they should be. They did shrink a little as well even on low heat. If he buys these pants again, he will buy a 34" inseam to be sure they are long enough after washing and drying.

I was looking forward to these Docker pants. The comfort waist pants are popular and I've tried a few. The waist on these pants fit fine. They were not baggy through the seat and thighs. What I was the most happy to see is someone finally made a pair of pants for us bigger guys, that have a true tapered leg. Usually the cuff is somewhere around 10 - 11 inches. These have a nice narrow cuff. Somewhere around 8-9 inches. It is the fit through the crotch / rise that does not fit. Crotch is too tight and rise is a bit too short. I returned them. I am curious to hear what others think.

I like the Docker's brand and I like the Roan color, it goes with my fall clothes scheme. First, i am a woman who buys men's pants because of the ability to buy by waist, inseam. It is so much better than guessing at what different women's brand sizing is. The deep pockets are just nicer too. Anyway, first bought 34/34 and thought they were too tight, not much but knew they would shrink in the wash. Returned and bought 36/34 and they fit great. Several hours later I'm cinching them in with my belt, and by the end of the day they were baggy and sagging all over. Washed in hot water and dried on high heat to shrink them and they felt good again. But again they stretched out all over. Have re-ordered in 34/34 in anticipation of them stretching a bit because I really like the color. Seem well constructed with a "fob" pocket along the seam of a regular pocket. Nice feeling fabric, hope they aren't so baggy!

These were supposed to be straight fit but instead we received tapered fit. My husband is 6’8” and 40x38, and boy it’s hard to find tall pants. These are almost tight around the ankles unless we roll it up once, that’s not happening, so I’m hoping they just messed up and sent us the wrong ones? But other then that fit is good around waist and length, he can’t wear his western boots with them and barely Sperrys. Now if he wasn’t in his late 50’s the tapered leg might work and I’m not saying it would be horrible for him to dress like our 18 yr old son but....it does eliminate the reason we bought them, which is for the office.

These trousers are wretchedly poor. The worst pants I have ever purchased. I am returning both pair.

I ordered 34" waist, 34" inseam. While marked 34"/34", both pair are in excess of thirty-seven inches in waist measurement and inseam, plus the truly execrable degree of stretch. Two percent "elastane?!" I can only conclude that "elastane" is another name for latex from a Trojan factory. And that the percentage is nearer fifty%.

These pants will not stay on my hips. A belt requires hideous gathering. I had to roll up the legs twice to keep them from ending under my heels. I want cotton in summer for breathability and comfort. The stretch component of these pants prevent them from breathing and they stick to my backside and legs with the least perspiration, requiring more-or-less constant tugging to pull them away trim the skin and have them drape. And they do not breath. According to my girlfriend, they seem to be intended for someone who pines for the sensation of worn-out panty hose.

These pants are utter crap. Worst garments I have ever bought. Since your customer service informs me you make no non-stretch pants, I am returning these useless bags and am ending my years-long purchasing history with your company.

These are nice pants, they fit well and I like the stretch. However if you are used to using a back pocket to hold your wallet and don't like using a button to secure the top once your wallet is in place these pants are not for you. The back pocket is shallow and to wide. If you have a normal sized wallet and you attempt to store it in the back pocket you will be losing it all the time, not to mention a pickpocket will never have an easier time stealing it out. Because of the gusseting of the back pocket it actually flares out towards the top vs the bottom of the pocket. I still wear my pair but never use the back pockets.

I love everything about pants ! I bought them for work and they look great. They feel great especially around the waist because of the flexi waist band it has . The size was right on point ! Great job i would recommend these pants to everyone!
I love these I've bought probably 5 pair. I usually wear a size 36 in pants but 34 fits better in these.
I really like these pants. The fit and look great. I would highly recommend.

I can't stress enough how much time I spent looking for a true go-to favorite brand and cut of pants. I've finally found the perfect pants for daily wear! Most cargo pants are either too loose, too stiff, have absurdly wide bottoms, or have overly puffy pockets. These have a slimmer profile but are still relaxed enough to be very casual and comfortable. The material has some stretch and give and is pretty soft (the black is a little stiffer than the two greys, which are my favorites). I work in a warehouse environment with lots of bending and stooping and these cargos have been great daily pants that hold up well. I bought 35x32 and initially needed a belt until I washed them, so they do shrink a little. I'm glad I bought 1" up in the waist from my usual. This accounted for washing and keeps the right balance between the slimmer fit and still having enough room in the thigh. I liked these enough that I immediately bought three more pairs.

Pants look good, and fit ok. Although a little slim.
Problem is - they are made of stretchy material. So if you put anything in side pocket, it will sag to your knee level. I cant use it for work because of that, and I do not need cargo pants for any other reason.. So if you just need it for looks, then you can buy it, but if you need it for work or for hiking and you want to put something in the pockets - I would not recommend it.

I ordered a pair of these trousers and they were sent from Germany, via Belgium, then customs at Rochester, and they arrived at Cambridgeshire in 6 days. Brilliant. Taking heed of what other reviewers have posted I ordered a waist size 2 inches smaller than I would have ordered had I not read this on their reviews. I would have normally ordered a 42" waist but I actually ordered 40" with 30" inside leg. Result - a perfect fit and very comfortable. They are elasticated and I will need to wear a belt as I would usually but this is what I expected anyway. Excellent fit, not at all baggy, and excellent value. In fact, I have since ordered, and received, the same size in dark grey and I am very pleased with them, too.

I normally buy my husband 32w/32l trousers from the supermarket (he's not too fussy!) but he doesn't like the modern tapered leg so I had to hunt around for alternatives and found these. He likes them but they are too wide around the waist and crotch area and tightening his belt makes them look awful with unintended pleats. We'll try again with a smaller size as they are exactly what he's looking for at a price I like. In fact we ended up going 2 sizes down (from 32" to 30" waist) as even the 31" waist was too baggy. They seem well made and the grey is a good colour.

The beauty about these cargo pants in not just the range of colours and the style but the fact that, whatever shape and size you are and no matter how far it is from your waist to your ankles, there's a size to fit you.
I bought my wife that new sewing machine for nothing ... she no longer needs to do any alterations ... out of the bag, in with the legs and walk away.
With the waist being flexible you can go down a size ... I've done both (my normal size and down a size) and both worked fine. This gives added flexibility when ordering as, if your chosen colour is not available in your normal waist size, then you still have another bite of the cherry.

These are a good quality trouser, in nice stretch cotton, they come up large, i,e a 36 will fit a 38 waist, the leg length is spot on though, leg width is just right and look great with trainers, sandals or desert boots. Leg pockets are great for phone and wallet and front pockets are deep and made out of good quality material. They are quite low rise at the front and fit well at the rear without being baggy. For the money i am very happy with these.
I
